paragraphs.content: Psalm 50
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 50

paragraphs.content: A Psalm of Asaph.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A Psalm of Asaph.

paragraphs.content: The mighty God, even the LORD, hath spoken, and called the earth from the rising of the sun unto the going down thereof.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The mighty God, even the Lord, hath spoken, and called the earth from the rising of the sun unto the going down thereof.

paragraphs.content: Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God hath shined.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God hath shined.

paragraphs.content: Our God shall come, and shall not keep silence: a fire shall devour before him, and it shall be very tempestuous round about him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Our God shall come, and shall not keep silence: a fire shall devour before him, and it shall be very tempestuous round about him.

paragraphs.content: He shall call to the heavens from above, and to the earth, that he may judge his people.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He shall call to the heavens from above, and to the earth, that he may judge his people.

paragraphs.content: Gather my saints together unto me; those that have made a covenant with me by sacrifice.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Gather my saints together unto me; those that have made a covenant with me by sacrifice.

paragraphs.content: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.

paragraphs.content: Hear, O my people, and I will speak; O Israel, and I will testify against thee: I am God, even thy God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hear, O my people, and I will speak; O Israel, and I will testify against thee: I am God, even thy God.

paragraphs.content: I will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices or thy burnt offerings, to have been continually before me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices or thy burnt offerings, to have been continually before me.

paragraphs.content: I will take no bullock out of thy house, nor he goats out of thy folds.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will take no bullock out of thy house, nor he goats out of thy folds.

paragraphs.content: For every beast of the forest is mine, and the cattle upon a thousand hills.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For every beast of the forest is mine, and the cattle upon a thousand hills.

paragraphs.content: I know all the fowls of the mountains: and the wild beasts of the field are mine.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I know all the fowls of the mountains: and the wild beasts of the field are mine.

paragraphs.content: If I were hungry, I would not tell thee: for the world is mine, and the fulness thereof.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If I were hungry, I would not tell thee: for the world is mine, and the fulness thereof.

paragraphs.content: Will I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of goats?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Will I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of goats?

paragraphs.content: Offer unto God thanksgiving; and pay thy vows unto the most High:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Offer unto God thanksgiving; and pay thy vows unto the most High:

paragraphs.content: And call upon me in the day of trouble: I will deliver thee, and thou shalt glorify me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And call upon me in the day of trouble: I will deliver thee, and thou shalt glorify me.

paragraphs.content: But unto the wicked God saith, What hast thou to do to declare my statutes, or that thou shouldest take my covenant in thy mouth?
paragraphs.contentHtml: But unto the wicked God saith, What hast thou to do to declare my statutes, or that thou shouldest take my covenant in thy mouth?

paragraphs.content: Seeing thou hatest instruction, and castest my words behind thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Seeing thou hatest instruction, and castest my words behind thee.

paragraphs.content: When thou sawest a thief, then thou consentedst with him, and hast been partaker with adulterers.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When thou sawest a thief, then thou consentedst with him, and hast been partaker with adulterers.

paragraphs.content: Thou givest thy mouth to evil, and thy tongue frameth deceit.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou givest thy mouth to evil, and thy tongue frameth deceit.

paragraphs.content: Thou sittest and speakest against thy brother; thou slanderest thine own mother’s son.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou sittest and speakest against thy brother; thou slanderest thine own mother’s son.

paragraphs.content: These things hast thou done, and I kept silence; thou thoughtest that I was altogether such an one as thyself: but I will reprove thee, and set them in order before thine eyes.
paragraphs.contentHtml: These things hast thou done, and I kept silence; thou thoughtest that I was altogether such an one as thyself: but I will reprove thee, and set them in order before thine eyes.

paragraphs.content: Now consider this, ye that forget God, lest I tear you in pieces, and there be none to deliver.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Now consider this, ye that forget God, lest I tear you in pieces, and there be none to deliver.

paragraphs.content: Whoso offereth praise glorifieth me: and to him that ordereth his conversation aright will I shew the salvation of God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whoso offereth praise glorifieth me: and to him that ordereth his conversation aright will I shew the salvation of God.
